task_summary: Perceive a cloth, approach and align to an edge, press to make contact, then push to create a fold before marking completion and retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 arm folds a pink cloth on a tabletop by pushing rather than pinching, consistent with the frames that show approach, contact, a sustained push, and retreat. The behavior starts with scanning and detection, then moves above the cloth, aligns to an edge, lowers until contact, and performs a directional push to crease the fabric. After the push, the system records a folded state and retreats to a safe height. Constraints include conservative timeouts, precise alignment, and gentle contact forces suitable for fabric.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the cloth
Camera provides a top view for detection
Gripper is open and safe to make contact
Table frame and push direction are defined
stepwise_plan: Move above the cloth and set end-effector yaw
Approach and align to an edge
Lower until contact at low force
Push along a direction to create a fold
success_criteria: Cloth shows a crease or reduced footprint after push
failure_and_recovery: Cloth not detected → rescan with raster pattern
Push stalls → retreat slightly and retry push with same direction
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after fold_state is set and a safe retreat is achieved.

frame_3.now_evidence: Clear first contact and alignment of end-effector with cloth edge indicating verified approach.
frame_3.predicts_next: Suggests that a push will follow along the edge-aligned direction to create a fold.

node_specs.description: Raster scan to localize the cloth reliably before approach.
Confirm the cloth pose after scanning.
Move to a standoff above the cloth to prepare alignment.
Orient tool yaw to align with intended push direction.
Laterally align the tool with a cloth edge for accurate contact.
Descend gently until contact is detected to avoid sliding the cloth prematurely.
Execute a push to crease and fold the cloth.
Record that the fold operation has been completed.
Back off to a safe distance after the fold.

failure_modes: Tool misaligned with edge causing slip
Contact not achieved due to height error
Push direction incorrect leading to unfold
recovery_strategy: Perform a short Retreat and retry Push
assumptions: Frames show push-based folding rather than two-corner grasping; tree reflects push creasing
Push direction_deg=180 assumes table frame where this matches observed lateral push

expected_success_criteria: Visible crease and reduced cloth area
